data.text: The IMF has said it will negotiate with Argentina after  the country's debt swap, that was delayed until 17 January.
Finnish mobile giant Nokia is losing the head of its networks division, the second senior executive to leave the unit in two weeks.
The Halifax bank, Britain's biggest mortgage lender, predicts a much-feared fall in the rampant UK property market.
AFP - Eurozone retail sales rose 0.7 percent in October from September but were down 0.2 percent compared with October 2003, the European statistics agency Eurostat reported.
